titleStmt.title: The vvorlds vvonder. Giving an account of two old men, lately known and seen in the city of Tholouze in France, who declare themselves to be above a thousand years old a peice [sic], and preach repentance to the world; telling what shall happen for these nine years following, and when the world shall end. Tune of, My bleeding heart.

The vvorlds vvonder. Giving an account of two old men, lately known and seen in the city of Tholouze in France, who declare themselves to be above a thousand years old a peice [sic], and preach repentance to the world; telling what shall happen for these nine years following, and when the world shall end. Tune of, My bleeding heart.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing W3593.
Verse: "Strange news to England lately come ..."
Cf. Wing W3593 which does not include W. Thackeray in the imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
